intro: Chloraea wittei, commonly known as the Witte's chloraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens.
